## Claiming This Task

Before you start working, check the **Assignees** section. If no one is assigned, leave a comment claiming the issue and assign it to yourself. This prevents duplicate work.

See the [Community Wiki](https://github.com/ibrahim-sisar/EduLite/wiki) for contributing guidelines and git workflow.

## Goal

*What will the contributor achieve?*
*(Example: Add a visual separator between the About and Open Source sections on the homepage.)*

## Task Description

*Step-by-step, what needs to be done? Note if it needs to work in dark mode or on mobile.*
*(Example: 1. Open Home.jsx. 2. Add a styled hr between sections. 3. Verify it looks right in light and dark mode.)*

## Definition of Done

*How does the contributor know they're finished?*
*(Example: The separator is visible on desktop and mobile, in both themes, with no layout breakage.)*

## Benefits

*How does this help EduLite? What will the contributor learn?*

## Skills You'll Practice

*List skills — be encouraging!*
*(Example: React components, Tailwind CSS, responsive design, Git basics.)*

## Files to be Altered (if known)

*List specific components, pages, or style files.*

## Testing

*How can they verify it works? Any visual checks, browser testing, or responsiveness to confirm?*

## Tips (Optional)

*Hints, gotchas, links to relevant docs, or encouragement.*
